greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Ternary digital root of n.
comment: Continued fraction expansion of sqrt(3) - 1. - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Dec 17 2007. Cf. A040001, A048878/A002530.
Minimum number of terms required to express n as a sum of odd numbers.
Shadow transform of even numbers A005843. - _Michel Marcus_, Jun 06 2013
link: Harry J. Smith, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..20000

Lorenz Halbeisen and Norbert Hungerbuehler, Number theoretic aspects of a combinatorial function, Notes on Number Theory and Discrete Mathematics 5(4) (1999), 138-150; see Definition 7 for the shadow transform.
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Digital Root.
formula: a(n) = n if n <= 2, otherwise a(A053735(n)).
Multiplicative with a(2^e) = 2, a(p^e) = 1 for odd prime p. - _Andrew Howroyd_, Aug 06 2018
maple: A134451:=n->((n+1) mod 2)+2*signum(n)-1; seq(A134451(n), n=0..100); # _Wesley Ivan Hurt_, Dec 06 2013
program: (PARI) { allocatemem(932245000); default(realprecision, 12000); x=contfrac(sqrt(3)-1); for (n=0, 20000, write("b134451.txt", n, " ", x[n+1])); } [_Harry J. Smith_, May 31 2009]
xref: Cf. A000010, A055034, A134452, A160390 (decimal expansion).
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Oct 27 2007
